leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 科研文献-检索/解析/引用网络生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 解析→抽取→索引→检索→评测
leaf_cluster.tool_form: 解析器 + 检索 + 评测

unit.unit_name: 引用抽取/引文网络/元数据对齐

tools.name: tetsuo-dox-agent
tools.one_line_profile: AI-powered research assistant for drafting answers with citations
tools.detailed_description: A research agent leveraging Large Language Models to provide technically-focused answers with robust citations. It employs a graph-based architecture to draft answers, perform self-reflection, conduct research, and iteratively improve responses.

tools.name: GIANT-Citation-String-Generator
tools.one_line_profile: Script to generate synthetic annotated bibliographic reference strings
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to generate tagged XML citation strings for training and evaluating citation parsing algorithms. It supports the creation of large-scale synthetic datasets for bibliometric analysis.

tools.name: CERMINE
tools.one_line_profile: Java library for extracting metadata and content from scientific PDFs
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Java library and tool for extracting metadata, bibliographic references, and structured full text from scientific articles in PDF format. It uses machine learning techniques for layout analysis and content classification.

tools.name: citation-network-explorer
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive tool for exploring and visualizing local citation networks
tools.detailed_description: A web-based tool that allows users to visualize and explore citation networks. It helps researchers understand the connections between papers and discover relevant literature through network visualization.

tools.name: CiteGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based visualizer for citation graphs
tools.detailed_description: A web application for visualizing citation graphs, enabling users to interactively explore the relationships between scientific publications.

tools.name: refchaser
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for backward and forward reference searching in systematic reviews
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool designed to assist with systematic reviews and literature reviews. It automates backward and forward reference searching, extracts references, creates search queries, ranks articles by relevance, and supports batch downloading of full-text PDFs.

tools.name: citation-graph-builder
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for creating and visualizing citation networks from PDFs and APIs
tools.detailed_description: A tool that combines citation data obtained from parsing paper PDF files and querying bibliographic APIs to create and visualize citation networks. Developed by Forschungszentrum Jülich (FZJ).

tools.name: BibliometricVisualization
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated platform for bibliometric visualization and analysis
tools.detailed_description: A bibliometric visualization platform that integrates Gestalt design principles, keyword extraction, temporal algorithms, machine learning, and large language models to analyze and visualize scientific literature data.

tools.name: OneCite
tools.one_line_profile: Intelligent toolkit for parsing and formatting academic references
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit designed to automatically parse, complete, and format academic references. It supports the Model Context Protocol (MCP) and aids in managing bibliographic data.

tools.name: PubTrends
tools.one_line_profile: Scientific literature explorer for visualizing and analyzing research trends and citation networks
tools.detailed_description: A tool that runs searches on Pubmed or Semantic Scholar and allows users to explore the high-level structure of result papers through visualization and topological analysis.

tools.name: MeDuSA
tools.one_line_profile: Fine-resolution cellular deconvolution method for RNA-seq data
tools.detailed_description: A method that leverages scRNA-seq data as a reference to estimate cell-state abundance in bulk RNA-seq data, useful for biological data analysis.

tools.name: novelpy
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for computing bibliometric novelty indicators
tools.detailed_description: A library designed to compute various novelty indicators for scientific publications based on co-occurrence matrices of references, keywords, or other metadata.

tools.name: Local Citation Network
tools.one_line_profile: Web application for literature review using local citation networks
tools.detailed_description: A tool that helps scientists perform literature reviews by visualizing and analyzing local citation networks using metadata from OpenAlex, Semantic Scholar, and Crossref.

tools.name: scimeetr
tools.one_line_profile: R package and Shiny app for bibliometric analysis and mapping
tools.detailed_description: A suite of functions and a web interface to load bibliometric data, create networks, identify research communities, and generate reading lists.

tools.name: LitStudy
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for automated scientific literature analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that enables researchers to perform literature analysis, including searching, refining, and visualizing bibliometric data within Jupyter notebooks.

tools.name: bibtexParseJs
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript library for parsing BibTeX files
tools.detailed_description: A library maintained by ORCID for parsing BibTeX formatted citations into JSON, facilitating the handling of bibliographic data in web applications.

tools.name: talaria_bibtex
tools.one_line_profile: OCaml library for parsing BibTeX files
tools.detailed_description: A parser for BibTeX files written in OCaml, useful for processing bibliographic databases in functional programming environments.

tools.name: Equi7Grid
tools.one_line_profile: Spatial reference system optimized for global high-resolution raster data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package defining the Equi7Grid, a spatial reference system designed to handle global high-resolution raster data efficiently with minimal distortion.

tools.name: metaknowledge
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for bibliometric and network analysis
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python library designed for doing bibliometric and network analysis in science and health policy research, supporting parsing, analysis, and visualization of citation data.

tools.name: pybibx
tools.one_line_profile: AI-powered bibliometric and scientometric Python library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that integrates artificial intelligence tools for performing bibliometric and scientometric analyses, including data processing and visualization.

tools.name: Scholia
tools.one_line_profile: Wikidata-based scholarly profile visualization tool
tools.detailed_description: A web service and tool that generates scholarly profiles for researchers, organizations, and topics using data from Wikidata, visualizing citation networks and research outputs.

tools.name: biblicit
tools.one_line_profile: Citation extraction tool for PDF documents
tools.detailed_description: A Ruby-based utility developed by Academia.edu to extract and parse citations directly from PDF files of scientific papers, facilitating metadata retrieval and citation network construction.

tools.name: biblib
tools.one_line_profile: Robust BibTeX parser and processing library
tools.detailed_description: A simple yet faithful BibTeX parser for Python 3 that handles common BibTeX idiosyncrasies, allowing for the manipulation, normalization, and analysis of bibliographic databases.

tools.name: Academic Review Tool (ART)
tools.one_line_profile: Automated pipeline for academic literature review and bibliometrics
tools.detailed_description: A Python package developed by the Alan Turing Institute to streamline the process of academic reviews. It provides capabilities for discovering, retrieving, and analyzing academic literature at scale, supporting systematic reviews and bibliometric studies.

tools.name: S2AND
tools.one_line_profile: Semantic Scholar's Author Name Disambiguation algorithm
tools.detailed_description: The official implementation of the Author Name Disambiguation (AND) algorithm used by Semantic Scholar. It provides a unified framework and evaluation suite for clustering author signatures into distinct author entities within bibliographic databases.

tools.name: Citeomatic
tools.one_line_profile: AI-powered citation recommendation system
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by AllenAI for citation recommendation, allowing users to find relevant citations for paper drafts based on text context. It leverages the Semantic Scholar OpenCorpus dataset to suggest missing references.

tools.name: peS2o
tools.one_line_profile: Pretraining Efficiently on S2ORC dataset
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit and dataset derived from S2ORC for pretraining language models on scientific text. It provides cleaned and filtered scientific papers to facilitate the development of Sci-BERT/Sci-LLM style models.

tools.name: S2ORC
tools.one_line_profile: The Semantic Scholar Open Research Corpus
tools.detailed_description: A large-scale corpus of English-language academic papers spanning many disciplines. While primarily a dataset, the repository serves as the entry point for accessing structured full-text and metadata for millions of scientific papers.

tools.name: s2orc-doc2json
tools.one_line_profile: Scientific paper parsers (PDF/TeX/JATS to JSON)
tools.detailed_description: A suite of parsers developed by AllenAI to convert scientific documents from various formats (PDF, LaTeX, JATS XML) into a unified, structured JSON format (S2ORC format), enabling large-scale text mining and analysis.

tools.name: openeditors
tools.one_line_profile: Data and scraper for scientific journal editors
tools.detailed_description: An R package and dataset for collecting and analyzing data about editors of scientific journals. It facilitates bibliometric research into editorial board composition, diversity, and network structures.

tools.name: Chinese-Elite
tools.one_line_profile: Social network mapping tool for elite relationships
tools.detailed_description: An experimental project that uses LLMs to parse public data and cross-reference official sources to map relationship networks of Chinese elites. While focused on social science/political science, it represents a tool for network inference from unstructured text.

tools.name: obsidian-reference-map
tools.one_line_profile: Citation network visualization for literature review
tools.detailed_description: An Obsidian plugin that creates interactive citation maps for literature reviews. It helps researchers visualize connections between papers, discover related works, and manage bibliographic references within their knowledge base.

tools.name: pythonbible
tools.one_line_profile: Library for parsing and normalizing scripture references
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed for Digital Humanities and Theological studies to parse, normalize, and validate references to scripture texts. It supports extracting structured citation data from unstructured text.

tools.name: geomodelgrids
tools.one_line_profile: Geographic referenced grid-based modeling library
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library developed by USGS for handling geographic referenced grid-based models. It supports querying and manipulating multi-resolution grid data for earth science applications like seismology and geology.

tools.name: arxivcheck
tools.one_line_profile: Utility to check arXiv publication status and update BibTeX metadata
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool that checks if an arXiv paper has been published in a peer-reviewed venue and updates the corresponding BibTeX entry with the official publication metadata.

tools.name: bibcure
tools.one_line_profile: CLI tool for managing and normalizing BibTeX files
tools.detailed_description: A command-line utility to keep BibTeX files up to date, normalize entries, and download papers associated with the bibliography.

tools.name: doi2bib
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to retrieve BibTeX metadata from DOIs
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight utility that fetches the BibTeX citation string for a given Digital Object Identifier (DOI).

tools.name: scihub2pdf
tools.one_line_profile: Bulk PDF downloader using DOIs or BibTeX files
tools.detailed_description: A tool to download research paper PDFs in bulk via DOI numbers, article titles, or BibTeX files, utilizing various repositories.

tools.name: title2bib
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to retrieve BibTeX metadata from paper titles
tools.detailed_description: A utility that searches for and returns the BibTeX citation format given a scientific paper's title.

tools.name: sidewall
tools.one_line_profile: Library for interacting with the Dimensions search API
tools.detailed_description: A Python library developed by Caltech Library to facilitate interaction with the Dimensions API for retrieving and analyzing scientometric data.

tools.name: nom-bibtex
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance BibTeX parser written in Rust
tools.detailed_description: A feature-complete and fast BibTeX parser implemented in Rust using the nom parser combinator library, suitable for high-throughput bibliographic data processing.

tools.name: python-bibx
tools.one_line_profile: Bibliometric analysis tools for Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library developed by Core of Science for performing bibliometric analyses, including processing and analyzing bibliographic data.

tools.name: GAKG
tools.one_line_profile: Multimodal Geoscience Academic Knowledge Graph framework
tools.detailed_description: A framework for constructing a multimodal Geoscience Academic Knowledge Graph by fusing information from paper illustrations, text, and bibliometric data.

tools.name: papergraph
tools.one_line_profile: AI/ML citation graph exploration platform
tools.detailed_description: A project providing a citation graph implementation for AI/ML papers using Postgres and GraphQL, enabling analysis and visualization of citation networks.

tools.name: tethne
tools.one_line_profile: Bibliographic network analysis library
tools.detailed_description: A Python module designed for parsing bibliographic data and generating networks for analysis, supporting various citation formats and network types.

tools.name: dimcli
tools.one_line_profile: CLI and Python client for Dimensions Analytics API
tools.detailed_description: The official Python client and command-line interface for interacting with the Dimensions Analytics API, facilitating scientometric research and data extraction.

tools.name: Docling
tools.one_line_profile: Advanced document parsing library for converting PDFs to structured formats for GenAI
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library designed to parse and convert documents (including complex scientific PDFs with tables, equations, and layouts) into structured formats like JSON and Markdown, enabling downstream Generative AI and analysis tasks.

tools.name: Alexandria3k
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance relational interface for open publication datasets
tools.detailed_description: A library and command-line tool that provides fast, relational SQL-like access to massive open bibliographic datasets such as OpenAlex and Crossref, facilitating large-scale bibliometric analysis and metadata retrieval.

tools.name: Etudier
tools.one_line_profile: Command-line tool for extracting citation networks from Google Scholar
tools.detailed_description: A utility to scrape and extract citation network data from Google Scholar profiles and publications, enabling the construction of citation graphs for bibliometric research.

tools.name: ScienceBeam Parser
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable PDF to XML conversion tool for scientific publications
tools.detailed_description: A set of tools utilizing Apache Beam and computer vision models to convert scientific PDF documents into structured XML (JATS/TEI) formats at scale, developed by eLife Sciences.

tools.name: OpenAlex Networks
tools.one_line_profile: Library for generating citation and co-authorship networks from OpenAlex
tools.detailed_description: A helper library designed to interface with the OpenAlex API, facilitating the retrieval of bibliographic data and the generation of citation and co-authorship networks for scientometric analysis.

tools.name: RefExtract
tools.one_line_profile: Bibliographic reference extraction tool for scientific articles
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by INSPIRE-HEP to extract, parse, and structure bibliographic references from scientific article PDFs, supporting the construction of citation networks in high-energy physics and beyond.

tools.name: AnyStyle
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and smart citation reference parsing library based on Conditional Random Fields
tools.detailed_description: AnyStyle is a very fast and smart parser for academic reference lists and bibliographies. It uses machine learning algorithms (Conditional Random Fields) to parse citation strings into structured data (BibTeX, JSON, CSL).

tools.name: AnyStyle CLI
tools.one_line_profile: Command-line interface for the AnyStyle citation parser
tools.detailed_description: The command-line interface wrapper for the AnyStyle library, allowing users to parse bibliographic references from the terminal and convert them into structured formats like BibTeX or JSON.

tools.name: bibtex-ruby
tools.one_line_profile: A strict BibTeX library, parser, and converter for Ruby
tools.detailed_description: A Ruby library for parsing, converting, and manipulating BibTeX files. It supports lexical analysis and parsing of BibTeX data, providing a robust foundation for bibliographic data management.

tools.name: citation_map
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to generate Gephi citation graphs from Zotero PDF collections
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool that analyzes text from PDFs stored in Zotero to create citation graphs compatible with Gephi. It helps in visualizing the connection between papers in a personal library.

tools.name: ScientoPy
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source scientometric analysis tool
tools.detailed_description: ScientoPy is a Python-based tool for performing scientometric analysis. It allows researchers to analyze bibliographic data (from Scopus, WoS) to identify trends, top authors, and research topics.

tools.name: reffix
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for fixing BibTeX reference lists using the DBLP API
tools.detailed_description: Reffix is a utility that cleans and corrects BibTeX reference lists by cross-referencing them with the DBLP computer science bibliography database, ensuring citation accuracy.

tools.name: GROBID
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents
tools.detailed_description: GROBID (GeneRation Of BIbliographic Data) is a machine learning library for extracting, parsing, and restructuring raw documents such as PDF into structured XML/TEI encoded data, with a focus on technical and scientific publications.

tools.name: grobid-astro
tools.one_line_profile: GROBID module for extracting astronomical entities from scholarly documents
tools.detailed_description: A specialized module for GROBID designed to recognize and extract astronomical entities (such as celestial objects, coordinates, and instrument names) from scientific texts.

tools.name: grobid-client-java
tools.one_line_profile: Java client library for GROBID REST services
tools.detailed_description: A Java client library to interact with the GROBID REST API, facilitating the integration of GROBID's document extraction capabilities into Java applications.

tools.name: grobid-client-node
tools.one_line_profile: Node.js client library for GROBID REST services
tools.detailed_description: A Node.js client library for consuming GROBID services, enabling JavaScript/TypeScript applications to perform scientific document parsing.

tools.name: grobid-client-python
tools.one_line_profile: Python client library for GROBID Web services
tools.detailed_description: A Python client for the GROBID web service, allowing Python users to easily extract metadata and citations from scientific PDFs in bulk.

tools.name: grobid-ner
tools.one_line_profile: Named-Entity Recogniser based on GROBID
tools.detailed_description: A module for GROBID that performs Named Entity Recognition (NER) on scientific texts, leveraging the structural parsing capabilities of the main GROBID engine.

tools.name: ParsCit
tools.one_line_profile: CRF-based reference string parsing package
tools.detailed_description: ParsCit is an open-source package for parsing reference strings and extracting citations from scholarly documents using Conditional Random Fields (CRF). It also includes modules for logical structure parsing of scientific articles.

tools.name: Global Canopy Height Model
tools.one_line_profile: High-resolution global canopy height estimation model using Sentinel-2 and GEDI data
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model for estimating canopy top height globally at high resolution (10m). It fuses Sentinel-2 optical imagery with sparse GEDI LIDAR data to generate continuous canopy height maps.

tools.name: Citation-Graph-Python
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for auto-generation of citation graphs from references
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to generate and visualize citation graphs from a set of papers. It helps researchers understand the citation network and relationships between publications.

tools.name: grobid-quantities
tools.one_line_profile: GROBID extension for identifying and normalizing physical quantities
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning module for GROBID that extracts, parses, and normalizes physical quantities (values and units) from scientific text.

tools.name: grobid-superconductors
tools.one_line_profile: GROBID module for superconductor material and properties extraction
tools.detailed_description: A specialized GROBID module designed to extract information about superconductor materials, their properties (like critical temperature), and related experimental conditions from scientific literature.

tools.name: structure-vision
tools.one_line_profile: Visualizer for document structures extracted by GROBID
tools.detailed_description: A visualization tool designed to display and inspect the structured data (XML/TEI) extracted by GROBID from PDF documents, aiding in the verification and analysis of extraction results.

tools.name: StrainScan
tools.one_line_profile: High-resolution strain-level microbiome composition analysis tool
tools.detailed_description: StrainScan is a bioinformatics tool for strain-level microbiome composition analysis. It uses a reference-based approach with k-mers to identify and quantify bacterial strains from metagenomic data.

tools.name: bibliometrix
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive science mapping analysis tool for R
tools.detailed_description: An R-tool for quantitative research in scientometrics and bibliometrics, providing various routines for importing bibliographic data, performing bibliometric analysis, and building data matrices for co-citation, coupling, scientific collaboration analysis, and co-word analysis.

tools.name: dimensionsR
tools.one_line_profile: R interface for Digital Science Dimensions API
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed to gather metadata about publications, patents, grants, clinical trials, and policy documents from the Digital Science Dimensions database using its DSL API, facilitating bibliometric data collection.

tools.name: draw-citation-graph
tools.one_line_profile: Citation graph generator from BibTeX and PDFs
tools.detailed_description: A Python script that attempts to generate a visual citation graph by analyzing a BibTeX file and a corresponding directory of PDF files, linking papers based on their references.

tools.name: CitationExtractor
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to extract canonical references from text
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to extract canonical references from textual documents, aiding in the creation of citation networks and metadata alignment.

tools.name: GetLattesData
tools.one_line_profile: R package for reading Lattes curriculum data
tools.detailed_description: An R package for downloading and reading data from the Lattes platform (Brazilian academic CV database), enabling scientometric analysis of researcher data.

tools.name: rscopus
tools.one_line_profile: Scopus Database API Interface to R
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides an interface to the Elsevier Scopus API, allowing users to retrieve bibliographic information, citation counts, and other metadata for bibliometric analysis.

tools.name: bibfix
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to repair bibliographic data
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed to repair and standardize bibliographic data, useful for cleaning datasets prior to bibliometric analysis or evidence synthesis.

tools.name: citationchaser
tools.one_line_profile: Forward and backward citation chasing tool
tools.detailed_description: An R package and Shiny app for performing forward and backward citation chasing, automating the process of finding related articles for systematic reviews and evidence synthesis.

tools.name: VOSviewer-Online
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based network visualization tool for bibliometrics
tools.detailed_description: The web-based version of VOSviewer, a popular tool for constructing and visualizing bibliometric networks such as co-citation, co-authorship, and term co-occurrence networks.

tools.name: citegraph
tools.one_line_profile: Citation network explorer
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for exploring and visualizing citation networks, allowing users to navigate the connections between scientific papers.

tools.name: PDF-Extract-Kit
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive toolkit for PDF content extraction
tools.detailed_description: A high-quality toolkit for extracting content from scientific PDFs, including layout analysis, formula detection, table extraction, and text parsing, essential for downstream scientific knowledge graph construction.

tools.name: openalex-pdf-parser
tools.one_line_profile: PDF parser powered by Grobid for OpenAlex
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based PDF parsing pipeline used by OpenAlex, leveraging Grobid to extract structured metadata and full text from scientific articles.

tools.name: pybliometrics
tools.one_line_profile: Python-based API-Wrapper to access Scopus
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that provides a wrapper for the Scopus API, enabling researchers to access and analyze citation data, author profiles, and publication metadata for bibliometric studies.

tools.name: bibtex-parser (PHP)
tools.one_line_profile: PHP library for parsing BibTeX files programmatically
tools.detailed_description: A PHP library designed to parse BibTeX files into structured data, enabling the integration of bibliographic metadata processing into PHP-based applications.

tools.name: bibtex-parser (JS)
tools.one_line_profile: BibTeX parser driving Better BibTeX for Zotero
tools.detailed_description: A robust JavaScript/TypeScript parser for BibTeX files, primarily developed for and used by the Better BibTeX extension for Zotero to handle complex citation data.

tools.name: bib2df
tools.one_line_profile: Parse BibTeX files into R data frames
tools.detailed_description: An R package that parses BibTeX files and converts them into tibbles (data frames), facilitating bibliometric analysis and data manipulation within the R ecosystem.

tools.name: bibtex
tools.one_line_profile: BibTeX parser for R
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing utilities to parse and manipulate BibTeX files, serving as a foundational library for bibliographic data processing in R.

tools.name: europepmc
tools.one_line_profile: R Interface to Europe PMC RESTful Web Service
tools.detailed_description: An R client for the Europe PMC RESTful API, allowing users to search and retrieve open access biomedical literature and metadata programmatically.

tools.name: openalexR
tools.one_line_profile: R client for retrieving bibliographic records from OpenAlex
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed to interface with the OpenAlex API, enabling researchers to query and analyze the massive graph of scholarly citations, authors, and institutions.

tools.name: rAltmetric
tools.one_line_profile: Query and visualize metrics from Altmetric.com
tools.detailed_description: An R package to retrieve and visualize alternative impact metrics (Altmetrics) for scholarly articles from the Altmetric.com API.

tools.name: python-bibtexparser
tools.one_line_profile: BibTeX parser for Python 3
tools.detailed_description: A widely used Python library for parsing, modifying, and writing BibTeX files, serving as a core component in many Python-based bibliometric and citation management workflows.

tools.name: habanero
tools.one_line_profile: Python client for Crossref search API
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that provides an interface to the Crossref API, allowing users to search for metadata of scientific publications, retrieve DOIs, and access citation data.

tools.name: GCMex
tools.one_line_profile: Matlab wrapper for Graph Cut algorithm
tools.detailed_description: A Matlab wrapper for the Graph Cut algorithm (max-flow/min-cut), commonly used in scientific image segmentation and computer vision research.

tools.name: metacheck
tools.one_line_profile: Metadata compliance checker for hybrid open access
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by SUB Göttingen to automatically check metadata compliance for hybrid open access publications, supporting library science and scholarly communication workflows.

tools.name: latex-utensils
tools.one_line_profile: LaTeX and BibTeX parser in TypeScript
tools.detailed_description: A TypeScript library providing parsers for LaTeX and BibTeX, commonly used in editors and tools (like VSCode extensions) to process and analyze scientific documents.

tools.name: scipdf_parser
tools.one_line_profile: Python parser for extracting content and figures from scientific PDF publications
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that parses scientific PDFs into structured JSON format. It leverages GROBID for text extraction and provides capabilities to extract sections, titles, abstracts, and figures from research papers.

tools.name: typst-biblatex
tools.one_line_profile: Rust library for parsing BibTeX and BibLaTeX files for the Typst typesetting system
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance Rust crate designed to parse and write BibTeX and BibLaTeX bibliography files. It serves as a core component for bibliography management in the Typst scientific typesetting ecosystem.

tools.name: ALIGNN
tools.one_line_profile: Atomistic Line Graph Neural Network for material property prediction
tools.detailed_description: A Python package implementing Atomistic Line Graph Neural Networks (ALIGNN) for predicting material properties from atomic structures. It captures both bond lengths and bond angles to model atomic interactions effectively.

tools.name: ReCiter
tools.one_line_profile: Enterprise author disambiguation system for academic institutions
tools.detailed_description: An open-source system developed by Weill Cornell Medicine for accurate author disambiguation in academic publications. It uses machine learning and institutional data to maintain up-to-date publication lists for researchers.

tools.name: ReCiter-PubMed-Retrieval-Tool
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for retrieving and synchronizing articles from PubMed
tools.detailed_description: A standalone utility designed to fetch article metadata from PubMed. It is part of the ReCiter ecosystem, facilitating the ingestion of publication data for author disambiguation and institutional reporting.

tools.name: deep_reference_parser
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning model for extracting references from text
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by Wellcome Trust that uses deep learning models to identify, extract, and parse bibliographic references from unstructured text documents.

tools.name: reach
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to parse references from policy documents
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning-based tool created by Wellcome Trust to scrape and parse references found in policy documents, enabling the tracking of research impact in policy making.

tools.name: semantic-scholar-fastmcp
tools.one_line_profile: MCP server for accessing Semantic Scholar API via LLM agents
tools.detailed_description: A FastMCP server implementation that provides a standardized interface for Large Language Model (LLM) agents to query the Semantic Scholar API. It enables AI-driven workflows to retrieve academic papers, author details, and citation networks.
